body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner James Watson a citizen of Frankfort States that on the 22 Day of March 1864 the Police Court of Frankfort rendered two Judgements against him of $50. each upon a charge of Selling liquor to Minors

The proof on the two cases was that two young men under 21 years of age drank liquor at your Petitioners Restaurant in Frankfort and the liquor was furnished to them by John Rupe one of your Petitioners bar Keepers.
Rupe Stated on oath (and Such in the fact) that your Petitioner positively prohibited him from selling to infants whom he went into his employment
Your Petitioner has always been careful not to violate the ban and has always directed his bar Keepers not to sell or give either to infants or Slaves
He pray, that said Judgments be remitted
The above is a true statement of the proof in the cases above named

Jno M Hewett Jr
City Attr.
April 28th 1864
John R Graham P. J. C f

Police Ct Frankfort
vs
Jas R Watson
2 Judgts
$50. each
Tipling
2nd May/64

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E bramlette
